Expressjs with Dinoloop

1. Adding Dinoloop to existing expressjs application

Dinoloop has been designed from the start for gradual adoption, and you can use as little or as much Dinoloop as you need. Perhaps you only want to develop some "REST APIs" using Dinoloop and other REST APIs with Expressjs. In this section, we will illustrate how to create add a Dinoloop REST API to an existing or newly created Express app

Step 1: Add HomeController (file: home.controller.ts)


        

        
Step 2: Mount Dinoloop and bind to express instance (file: app.ts)

        

            

        

        
Dinoloop is mounted on
            /api and all of its controller routes/endpoints are also mounted on
            /api. Dinoloop will handle those requests which are mounted on
            /api i.e.
            /api/home/get, the other end points
            /home and
            /about which are created by Expressjs are not handled by Dinoloop. This way you can slowly migrate your existing
            Expressjs app to Dinoloop or you can start writing a new REST APIs using Dinoloop in combination with Expressjs.
